content.webTitle: Everton v Manchester United: match preview

fields.headline: Everton v Manchester United: match preview
fields.bodyText: Nineteen months on from what was, at that point, the nadir of his Old Trafford reign Ole Gunnar Solskjær returns to Goodison Park still under pressure and with questions surrounding the commitment of the same core of players who folded in that 4-0 defeat to Marco Silva’s Everton. So much for change or improvement. Two poor away defeats in succession – both without Richarlison, who remains suspended – demonstrated that Everton, like United, flatter to deceive. Both managers require a reaction urgently. Andy Hunter Saturday 12.30pm BT Sport 1 Venue Goodison Park Last season Manchester United 1 Everton 1 Odds H 2-1 A 9-5 D 5-2 Referee Paul Tierney This season G4 Y12 R1 3.25 cards/game MANCHESTER UNITED Subs from Grant, Henderson, Williams, Mengi, Mata, Fosu-Mensah, Ighalo, Pellistri, Lindelöf, Van de Beek, James, Cavani, Telles, Pogba, Matic Doubtful Lindelöf (back) Injured Jones (knee, Dec), Bailly (knock, 21 Nov), Lingard (knock, 21 Nov) Suspended None Discipline Y13 R1 Form LWLWDL Leading scorer Fernandes 3 EVERTON Subs from Olsen, Lössl, Virgínia, Kenny, Godfrey, Branthwaite, Nkounkou, Holgate, Gomes, Bernard, Davies, Tosun, Simms Doubtful Holgate (toe) Coleman (hamstring) Injured Gbamin (achilles, Dec), Delph (knock, unknown) Suspended Richarlison (last of three) Discipline Y11 R2 Form WWWDLL Leading scorer Calvert-Lewin 8
